Some change in the code between earlier today and May 31st has caused
a mas=
sive slowdown in the speed which I'm downloading data.  On the
same machine=
, configured in the same way, a version of Heritrix I
built from CVS, from =
earlier today, could not muster more than 30K/s
on the same seed file that =
the May 31st version is currently doing
728K/s.

Perhaps the difference is =
in configuration?  Maybe I'm enabling a
newer configuration variable which =
is slowing things down?  The
difference between the order.xml files are onl=
y additions in the newer
version:

reread-seeds-on-config: true
use-bdb-for=
-cookies: true
the universal extractor (with default configuration)
LinkSco=
per instead of Postselector (with default configuration)

Would any of the =
log files be of use to track down the problem?

Thanks.

-matt
